item.title: différance and deconstruction in biology
item.description: According to Stiegler, the différance of Derrida is: [!quote] the question of a process that, by deffering its own accomplishment, differentiates itself, this differentiation producing traces, which is also to say, grammes, forms of writing and of what Of Grammatology called ‘supplements’.

item.title: draft on the decline of theorization in science
item.description: ==French version== Résumé Divers acteurs ont récemment sonné l’alarme concernant le déclin de la capacité des articles scientifiques à faire rebondir la recherche dans de nouvelles directions, c’est-à-dire à proposer de nouvelles théories.

item.title: note on Rovelli2017
item.description: Is time’s arrow perspectival? by Rovelli C. (2017) Reference: Rovelli2017 Boltzmann’s entropy (but also Gibb’s) resorts to coarse-graining of the phase space into several macrostates.

item.title: pre-note on the organicist tradition
item.description: Kant (teleology) In 1790, Immanuel Kant refers to biological systems as self-organising entities, but struggles to reconcile teleology and mechanical physics.

item.title: note on Montévil2021
item.description: Computational empiricism : the reigning épistémè of the sciences by Montevil M. (2021) Abstract: What do mainstream scientists acknowledge as original scientific contributions?

item.title: note on Paic2019
item.description: Governance of science and technology policies by Paic A., Viros C. (2019) OECD Reference: Paic2019 The neoliberal era of science ( Nedeva2006, Davies2006, Mirowski2011, Lazebnik2018) herits from a organization of Science that already has some internal contradictions.

item.title: note on Hayek1945
item.description: The Use of Knowledge in Society by Hayek F.A. (1945) The American Economic Review 35: 519–530 Reference: Hayek1945 Hayek’s contribution is identifying the mechanism of the market system Briefly, we sketch the essence of a market organization.
